content: marled textures hat by kaity fraker ​ materials 1 ball classic elite liberty wool 100% washable wool 122 yards per 50g ball ​​ 1 ball ewe ewe yarns wooly worsted 100% superwash merino 95 yards per 50g ball ​​ note this hat uses the entire ball of ewe ewe wooly worsted you will need 2 ​ ​ balls if you make the hat any larger or longer us size 10 5 16 circular needles us size 10 5 double pointed needles stitch marker tapestry needle scissors gauge 14 stitches = 4 in seeded rib pattern with both yarns held together finished measurements to fit average teen-adult head finished hat measures 19 around ©kaity fraker 2015 1 seeded rib pattern stitch round 1 k to end of round round 2 *k1 p1 repeat from * to end of round pattern with one strand of each yarn held together and circular needles co 64 sts pm to indicate beginning of round join to work in round being careful not to twist work in k1 p1 ribbing until piece measures 1 begin working in seeded rib pattern until piece measures 6 from co edge being sure to finish with round 2 next round *k16 pm repeat from * 3 more times knit to end of round decrease as follows round 1 *ssk work in st pattern as established to 3 sts before next m k2tog p1 sm repeat from * 3 more times round 2 k around repeat rounds 1 and 2 5 more times 16 sts remain next round *sl 1 k2tog psso p1 repeat from * 2 more times 8 sts remain finishing cut yarns pull through remaining sts and cinch tight weave in ends on inside of hat abbreviations co cast on st s stitch es k knit p purl m marker pm place maker ssk slip slip knit k2tog knit 2 together sl 1 k2tog psso slip 2 knit 2 together pass slipped stitch over ©kaity fraker 2015 2
